intro: Guettarda viburnoides var. genuina, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands.
